meanings.definition: The quality or state of being divided into two parts or branches.
meanings.sent1: The bifidity of the river created a beautiful island in the middle.
meanings.sent2: The tree's bifidity made it look like it had two trunks.
meanings.sent3: The bifidity of the cake made it easy to share with my friend.
meanings.sent4: Her hair's bifidity resembled a fork in the road.
meanings.sent5: The bifidity of the puzzle piece helped me match it perfectly.

meanings.definition: The condition of having two clefts or notches.
meanings.sent1: The bifidity of the rock allowed small creatures to hide in its crevices.
meanings.sent2: The bifidity of the paper made it easier to tear in half.
meanings.sent3: The bifidity of the cookie made it look like a smiling mouth.
meanings.sent4: The bifidity of the canyon walls was awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The bifidity of the book's pages made it easier to flip through.
